# Battle of Mulayda__disambig_1

| date              = 21 January 1891
| place             = Qassim region, (in today's Saudi Arabia)
| result            = Decisive Rashidi victory
*End of Second Saudi State
| combatant1        =  Rashidi State
*Shammar
*Harb
*Dhafeer
| combatant2        =  Second Saudi State
*Al-Qassim
*Mutair
*Otaiba
| commander1        =  Muḥammad bin ʿAbdullah Al Rashid
| commander2        =  Hassan ibn Muhanna Zamil ibn Sulaym

| strength2         = 24,000
| casualties1       = Unknown
| casualties2       = Unknown

The Battle of Mulayda was the last major battle during the period of the Second Saudi State which occurred on 21 January 1891. Following problems over Zakat and the arrest of the Rashidi leader, Ibn Sabhan, the Rashidis planned to end the Saudi State and conquer both Qassim region and Riyadh. The Rashidis and their Arab ally clans successfully ended the Second Saudi State, forcing the House of Saud, led by Abdul Rahman bin Faisal, and their allies to flee.
